general_advisory: No rainfall and dry weather expected during next five days. So, go for irrigation in crop field as per requirement. Apply well decomposed Farm Yard Manure/vermicompost during last ploughing in the field. Before raising any crop go for collection of soil sample and test it in a nearby soil testing laboratory. Apply balanced fertilizers in all the crops as per soil test based recommendations mentioned in the soil health card.

advisory: Complete the sowing of pre-germinated treated seeds in puddled soil by broadcasting or drum seeder and maintain a thin film of water for proper establishment and early growth of seedlings.
Nutrient Management: Apply 44 kg of DAP and 33 kg of MOP per acre as a basal dose at the time of puddling.

Weed Management: Spray Pyrazosulfuron-ethyl 10%WP (Sathi) @ 80g/acre at 3-5 days after sowing (DAS) in 130 litres of water when there is a thin film of soil moisture or broadcast ready mix Bensulfuron methyl + Pretilachlor granular herbicide mixed with 4kg of sand.

Pest Management: Prevailing weather condition favours the development of sucking pest like aphid, jassids, and whitefly. Install yellow sticky trap @ 8nos/acre to monitor the pest population. Apply Neem oil-based pesticide Azadiractin 0.03% (300 ppm) @ 5ml/ltr of water at the initial stage of infestation.
Arhar is at pod filling stage and chances of pod borer infestation in the field, to control it spray Chlorpyriphos 20 % EC @ 2 ml/litre of water or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 2 ml/litre of water.
Weed Management: Apply Quizalfop-ethyl 5% EC or Imazethapyr 10 SL @ 300 ml/acre mixed with 200 liters of water at 20-25 DAS.

Pest Management: Leaf eating caterpillar: The insects usually feed on the tender young leaves. Spray Profenophos 50 EC 400ml per acre mixed with 200 liters of water for its control. Aphid and Whitefly: Prevailing weather condition is favorable for the incidence of sucking pest like aphid and whitefly. Install yellow sticky traps @ 8nos/acre at the vegetative stage to monitor pest population and apply neem oil-based pesticide Azadiractin 0.03% (300 ppm) @ 5ml/ltr of water at the initial stage of infestation.
Weed Management: Apply Quizalfop-ethyl 5% EC or Imazethapyr 10 SL @ 300 ml/acre mixed with 200 liters of water at 20-25 DAS.

Pest Management: Leaf eating caterpillar: The insects usually feed on the tender young leaves. Spray Profenophos 50 EC 400ml per acre mixed with 200 liters of water for its control. Aphid and Whitefly: Prevailing weather condition is favorable for the incidence of sucking pest like aphid and whitefly. Install yellow sticky traps @ 8nos/acre at the vegetative stage to monitor pest population and apply neem oil-based pesticide Azadiractin 0.03% (300 ppm) @ 5ml/ltr of water at the initial stage of infestation.
Complete the sowing of Green pea in the fallow lands. High yielding varieties suitable for Odisha such as Pravat, Uttara, and T-163. Use 30 kg seeds/acre with a spacing of 30 x 10 cm.
Before sowing seeds are to be treated with Vitavax Power @ 2.5 g/kg seeds. Apply 30:50:50 kg N-P2O5-K2O per hectare during the final land preparation.

Nutrient Management: At a three-week stage, undertake hoeing, weeding and apply Urea @ 55kg/ac followed by irrigation. Go for hoeing, weeding and apply 27 kg urea + 25kg MOP at the six-to-seven-week stage followed by irrigation.

Pest Management: Dimond back moth: Spray Fipronil 5% SC @ 2ml/ltr or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 4ml/ltr of water as a control measure. Tobacco leaf eating caterpillar: Spray Cyantraniliprole 10.26% OD @ 6ml/5 ltr of water to control the pest population. Cabbage Aphid: Spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 2g/5ltr of water as a control measure.

Nutrient Management: At a three-week stage, undertake hoeing, weeding and apply Urea @ 55kg/ac followed by irrigation. Go for hoeing, weeding and apply 27 kg urea + 25kg MOP at the six-to-seven-week stage followed by irrigation.

Pest Management: Dimond back moth: Spray Fipronil 5% SC @ 2ml/ltr or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 4ml/ltr of water as a control measure. Tobacco leaf eating caterpillar: Spray Cyantraniliprole 10.26% OD @ 6ml/5 ltr of water to control the pest population. Cabbage Aphid: Spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 2g/5ltr of water as a control measure.

Nutrient Management: At a three-week stage, undertake hoeing, weeding and apply Urea @ 55kg/ac followed by irrigation. Go for hoeing, weeding and apply 27 kg urea + 25kg MOP at the six-to-seven-week stage followed by irrigation.

Pest Management: Dimond back moth: Spray Fipronil 5% SC @ 2ml/ltr or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 4ml/ltr of water as a control measure. Tobacco leaf eating caterpillar: Spray Cyantraniliprole 10.26% OD @ 6ml/5 ltr of water to control the pest population. Cabbage Aphid: Spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 2g/5ltr of water as a control measure.

Pest Management: Thrips: Prevailing weather condition is favorable for thrips attack. Install Blue Sticky Trap @ 8nos/acre to control and monitor pest population. Apply neem-based pesticide Azadiractin 1500 ppm @ 3ml/liter of water at the initial stage of infestation. To control chemically apply 3 g Acetamiprid 15% SP or 4 ml Imidacloprid 17.8% SL mixed with 15 liters of water.

Pest Management: Wilting: In view of high humid condition wilting may occur at this stage. Spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g/ltr of water if the symptom is noticed. Fruit & Shoot borer: Install pheromone trap @ 8nos/acre to monitor the pest population.
